lead_paragraph: Ken Stabler, the former N.F.L. quarterback and current Alabama football radio color analyst, has been granted a leave of absence for the coming season after his arrest on a drunken driving charge in June. His arrest in south Alabama was at least the third time he has been charged with D.U.I. Stabler, the Tide’s color analyst for 10 years, will be replaced by Tom Roberts.
